summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) training sign-in sheet and accompanying presentation slides for a Suicide Prevention/SHU Training course at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The training, dated December 7, 2018, covers suicide risk management for inmates in Special Housing Units (SHU), with specific focus on high-risk groups including mentally ill, behavior disordered, sex offender, and protective custody inmates. The material outlines policies, procedures, and the importance of the Psychology Advisory List (TRU-SCOPE) for monitoring at-risk inmates.

keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons conducted specialized suicide prevention training for staff at MCC New York, focusing on inmates in Special Housing Units (SHU).
Training materials state that 30-80% of inmate suicides in the BOP occur on locked units like SHUs, and single cells in these units are especially risky.
High-risk groups identified include mentally ill inmates, behavior disordered inmates, sex offenders, and protective custody inmates.
The training emphasized the Psychology Advisory List (TRU-SCOPE) as a key tool for identifying inmates with mental health conditions who may become dangerous or suicidal when placed in the SHU.
Policy recommendations included double-celling inmates in SHU whenever possible to reduce isolation and suicide risk, and placing at-risk inmates in higher visibility cells if single-celled.
